subject: Sexual Health
title: Spermicides and Gels
description: A micro-lesson that makes Spermicides and Gels usable.

hook.text: Chemical agents that kill or immobilize sperm have been used for centuries in various forms.

buildup.text: Modern spermicides contain nonoxynol-9, a surfactant that damages sperm cell membranes on contact.

discovery.text: Used alone, spermicides are only about 72% effective. They work best combined with barrier methods.

twist.text: Nonoxynol-9 can irritate mucous membranes, actually increasing STI risk with frequent use.

climax.text: New acid-based gels avoid irritation while still immobilizing sperm, offering a safer chemical option.

punchline.text: Chemistry as contraception. Simple but limited alone.

quiz.question: Why is nonoxynol-9 controversial?
options: It can irritate mucous membranes and raise STI risk
It causes allergic reactions in all users
